About

I am a Postdoctoral Research Scientist in the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science at Columbia University, affiliated with both the Applied Physics and Applied Mathematics Department and the Data Science Institute. I am working with Qiang Du on the mathematical analysis of Deep Learning models, and on numerical algorithms for nonlocal PDEs with applications in peridynamics.

I received my PhD in Applied Mathematics in 2017 from the University of Oxford where I studied numerical algorithms for differential equations with periodicity with Nick Trefethen.

Prior to this I completed a M.Sc. in Applied Mathematics at the University of Toulouse and a M.Sc. in Aerospace Engineering at the French National Higher School of Aeronautics.
